intro: Secamone andamanica, commonly known as the Andaman secamone, is a flowering plant native to the Andaman Islands. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It has simple, opposite leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. Secamone andamanica is often found in moist, shaded areas of tropical forests.
